text.0_Chapter, 1_Verse: Genesis 4:2 "Hevel"  - Robert Alter translates "hevel" as breath or vapor, something utterly insubstantial and transient, aptly applied to the short life of Hevel, only the forth human in Creation ( after Adam, Eve, and Cain), his life cut short by murder by a brother, his fleeting life span.
text.0_Chapter, 2_Verse: - See Genesis, Note on 4:2, and Qohelet, Chapter 1, FN 2, The Hebrew Bible - Robert Alter [MS: copyright material - Limited  Fair Use only.]
